::Prowl::

The anger disintegrates almost instantly as Prowl feels Iron Raptor's 
sadness, telling that she was a bit afraid of him. He looked into her 
eyes as she sheathed her sword and stepped behind him. He definetly 
didn't want her to be afraid of him. He loved her. He couldn't 
believe he had let anger take over.

Shame and regret now rose up to his mind. He was ashamed at how he 
let the anger flow, and regretful at how he made Iron Raptor feel.

-I'm sorry, love,- he thinks to her, -I didn't mean to feel that way, 
I reall didn't.-

Prowl looks at Shadow. He would get to fight him, yes. But 
considering how he got the privelage, this battle was not going to be 
good. The Maximal was ready to fight, his metallic body standing tall.

-Do you think we should get this battle over with or get to the 
Cybertronian Fire?- he thinks to Iron Raptor, keeping his eyes on 
Shadow.








--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Now, with her mind in more controle of her body she suddenly 
recieved 
> something that made her nearly drop her sword.
> The...intensity of Prowls anger, and the realizations of what she 
had done 
> just now.
> She had just done what she had given Prowl slag for less then 30 
cycles ago. 
> Interfering with battle.
> But it was so harsh, almost as bad as hate!
> But it effected her in rather a way that was surprising.
> She felt...felt afraid of him...felt...sad.
> 
> So, right there and then she simply lifted her sword, rather slowly 
like a 
> dog who just got cought at something, and shethed it.
> Standing straight the looking back towards Prowl before she simply 
backed 
> uop behind him, her shoulders clearly slumped.
> It felt...so intense that she felt almost as if she didn't belong.
> It was wierd, how this body reacted to feelings.*
>
